config.question: Which of the following is a reason why many felt the government formed through the Articles of Confederation was powerless?

choices.content: The government lacked the power to tax people.
The government had a single legislative body.
Larger states had a stronger hold on the government.
Only some of the states were represented in the national government.

answer_3.response: The Articles denied Congress the power of taxation, a serious oversight in time of war. To obtain funds, the national government had to ask the states for contributions, called requisitions. If a state failed to cooperate—and many did—Congress limped along without financial support.
